repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - First, Second, and Third
            Programmatic Development Policy Loan for Sustainable
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First, Second, and Third
            Programmatic Development Policy Loan for Sustainable
            Development Project for Colombia were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was low
            or negligible, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            the Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: the analytical work conducted as part of
            the Country Environmental Analysis (CEA) and in preparation
            for the first operation provided a thorough examination of
            environmental priorities and an understanding of the
            country's institutional framework for environmental
            management. The actual process of carrying out the analysis
            was equally as important, as it helped to build consensus
            among stakeholders on reforms to the National Environmental
            System (SINA). Inter-institutional coordination is essential
            for strengthening the reform program. Inter-institutional
            coordination, in particular National Planning Department
            (DNP) participation in the DPL Program has been instrumental
            in enhancing coordination among key SINA actors as well as
            other line ministries. This coordination among line
            ministries, as well as vertically between national and
            regional authorities, has enriched policy development in the
            areas of air quality, water quality, and environmental
            health, as well as data collection required for the
            monitoring of SINA's progress toward goals linked with
            sustainable development and the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs).

6282813.trustfund:
TF051886-PHRD-COLOMBIA: SUSTAINABLE
            DEVELOMENT PROGRAMMATIC STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMEN

repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Programmatic Development Policy
            Loan for Sustainable Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Programmatic Development Policy Loan
            (DPL) for Sustainable Development Project will support the
            government of Colombia's efforts to attain the
            Millennium Development Goals (MDGs), in particular, towards
            ensuring environmental sustainability. Specifically, the
            program will improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the
            National Environmental System (SINA), and, integrate
            principles of sustainable development into key sectors, with
            a particular emphasis on protecting the most vulnerable
            groups. The Program will improve environmental management,
            particularly in urban areas, and, will support the
            development of a results-based framework for planning and
            monitoring progress of the SINA, as well as improvements in
            inter-institutional coordination, and increased public
            participation in environmental decision-making. In addition,
            preparation of critical policies, and laws related to air
            quality, water quality, solid waste management, and
            environmental licensing will also be supported. Improvements
            in air and water quality in urban centers will lead to
            decreased morbidity, and mortality rates, and other health
            effects. Increased accountability, transparency and improved
            public participation will provide the most vulnerable groups
            a voice in environmental decision-making. Several risks have
            been identified, most important, the overall political
            context, namely the internal conflict and violence
            associated with illegal drug activity, which could
            negatively affect the fiscal and macroeconomic environment,
            while aggravating the social situation. Throughout the
            reform program, several actions are being undertaken to
            mitigate risks, that is, through complementary actions in
            other sectors to support the development of a stronger
            foundation for peace, and reforms, allowing resources to be
            used for the transition to a post-conflict Colombia.
